Peakbagger.com. Retrieved 2012-01-22.</ref> | map = Nepal | map_caption = Location in Nepal | label_position = left | location = [[Nepal]]-[[Tibet]] | range = [[Himalayas]] | lat_d = 28 | lat_m = 00 | lat_s = 53 | lat_NS = N | long_d = 86 | long_m = 49 | long_s = 41 | long_EW = E | coordinates_ref = | first_ascent = 1962 by [[Gerhard Lenser]] | easiest_route = snow/ice climb }} '''Pumori''' ({{lang-ne|पुमोरि}}) (or '''Pumo Ri''') is a [[mountain]] on the [[Nepal]]-[[Tibet]] border in the [[Mahalangur Himal|Mahalangur]] section of the [[Himalaya]]. Pumori lies just eight kilometres west of [[Mount Everest]]. Pumori, which means "Unmarried Daughter" in the [[Sherpa language]], was named by [[George Mallory]]. Climbers sometimes refer to Pumori as "Everest's Daughter". Pumori is a popular climbing peak and the easiest route is graded [[Yosemite decimal system|class 3]], although with significant avalanche danger. Pumori was first climbed in 1962 by [[Gerhard Lenser]] on a [[Germany|German]]-[[Switzerland|Swiss]] expedition. Two [[Czech Republic|Czechs]] (Leopold Sulovský and Zdeněk Michalec) climbed a new route on the south face in the spring of 1996 ([[Joe Simpson]], 1997, ''Dark Shadows falling''). An outlier of Pumori is [[Kala Patthar]] (5,643m/18,513'), which appears as a big brown bump below the impressive south face of Pumori. Many trekkers going to see Mount Everest up close will attempt to climb to the top of Kala Patthar. ==Notable ascents== * 1962 FA by Gerhard Lenser of a German-Swiss expedition. * 1974 ''West Face'' new route by Alpine Club Unpo, Japan, summit reached by Minoru Takagi and Nobuyaki Kaneko on Oct 13.<ref>{{cite journal | last = Fujita | first = Hiroshi | title = Climbs and Expeditions 1974 | journal = American Alpine Journal | volume = 20 | issue = 49 | pages = 198–199 | publisher = American Alpine Club | location = New York, NY, USA | year = 1975 | isbn = }}</ref> * 1986 ''East Face'' new route by Hiroshi Aota and Yoshiki Sasahara (Japan) over three days, summiting on December 3.<ref name="Cheney 1987 238">{{cite journal | last = Cheney | first = Michael | title = Climbs and Expeditions 1986 | journal = American Alpine Journal | volume = 29 | issue = 61 | pages = 238 | publisher = American Alpine Club | location = New York, NY, USA | year = 1987 | isbn = 0-930410-29-7 }}</ref> * 1986 ''1985 Catalan Route'' on East Face, solo by Todd Bibler, summit reached December 5.<ref name="Cheney 1987 238"/> ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:Mountains of Nepal]] [[Category:Mountains of Tibet]] [[Category:China–Nepal border]] [[Category:International mountains of Asia]] [[Category:Seven-thousanders]]
